text:
If i try to enter Alice ڱ
into a user name, i get this in the xml:

<name xmlns="">Alice ڱ</name> 

this happens for both 1.2 and trunk.
creator: gregor@apache.org
gregor@apache.org
text:
this is (as usual with utf-8) a complete clusterfuck.

i tried all sorts of things from
http://wiki.apache.org/cocoon/RequestParameterEncoding including

* form-encoding
* container-encoding
* setting the mime-type to text/html; charset=utf-8
* setting accept-charset="utf-8" on the form
* adding var value = new Packages.java.lang.String(value.getBytes("ISO-8859-1"),
"UTF-8"); at usecases.js:30

the js hack got the user names to save correctly as utf-8, but in turn screwed
up any other text entry (say, meta tab for instance)

i have no further ideas for this :(

fixed in lenya-trunk in rev 370449

however, the user name has to be entered as e.g. "test-ä" and not "test-ä".
(the latter will be saved as <name>test-&#228;</name> and displayed again as
"test-ä")
creator: josias.thoeny@wyona.org

text:
i had a user with pakistani ancestry, and he would happily sign his name in
farsi without any problems. the issue seems to be as josias says: the text has
to be entered literally - & will be escaped, and that's how it's supposed to be.
